text: Przegazowane. Pół butelki znalazło się na podłodze. Kwaśne, owocowe, ziołowe, dziwne

Beer share at Lennarts, Malmö - Orange pour with white head. Fruity and hoppy with some prominent bretty farmhouse notes, some herbal floral action, sweet malty and yeasty, slight spice into the close.

Big pop and gusher. Cloudy. Tan. Big head with a fairly thick head. On the nose, just a lot of brett with a touch of sweet malts. Fizzy, dry, yeasty and bretty. Malt character has really been eaten away.

Enjoyed at the Casey tasting at Jeffs House on April 02. 750 mL bottle as Brett Devo. This baby gushed all over as soon as the cork popped. The pour is a darker golden orange with a thick white head and a couple spots of lace as it recedes (very slowly). The aroma is something else. There is a strong sweetness to it and a funkiness that just cant be ignored. There is a lot of yeast and bready malts backing that up. The flavor is lightly citrusy, but the strong funk really kicks in. The bready malts arent my thing at all, and this seems far too yeasty. I think there was some over-conditioning in the bottle. The mouth feel is a little heavier and really brightly carbonated with a bitter rind and sweet funk on the back end. Its something else.

0.375l corked bottle from Ølbutikken. What a head! A gigantic monster of a head on this one that never settles down. Would even go so far as to call it everlasting. Really big bubbly, lacing and white in color. All this on top of a blurry straw golden beer. What a bretta lovely aroma. Lately Ive just completely fallen in love with this brett aroma, and to my luck, it seems like they kind of beers is popping up everywhere these days. Fantastic funky with a soft lemony sourness, lots of slightly sour berries, gooseberries, white wine, a little bit of straw and it just smells summery and fantastic. As expected its not directly flat on the carbonation this, rather on the other side of that scale and it has a light oily mouthfeel. Not much sweetness left in this email. As good as bone dry actually. Really refreshing, and the brett has gone completely bananas. Funk, straw, lots of brett, something slightly minerally and as mentioned not any sweetness left what so ever here. Such a interesting and exciting beer. Would not mind having in a couple of glasses with this tasty nectar on a warm summer night. Top stuff! 04.06.2013

750, corked and baled. Pours a cloudy bright pale gold with a dense and fizzy white head that surges; best to open this one over or in the sink. Light tangy floral and mineral nose. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Lightly sweetened cheerio base with tangy floral and mineral notes on the mid palate. Crisp dry finish with light floral notes. Clean and nicely done.

Bottled @ Broken Dreams, vintage 2013. Hazy golden, several small bubbles in the glass, mid-size white head, good lacing. Mild funky aroma, brettanomyces, mature yellow cheese, horse blanket, hay and ripe pears. Medium carbonated, smooth and crisp mouthfeel. Funky barnyard taste, hay, bun dough, floral hops, pear and ripe apples. Funky finish that lingers.
Bottle at Culmination Fest 16: Poured a hazy to clear golden with a fluffy white head. Aroma is funky spicy with some pungent citrus. Taste is citrus and spicy, funky some yeast.

Bottle at a tasting in Billdal 160721. Hazy golden beer with a decent offwhite head. Sourish fruity aroma, grapes, vinous, yeasty notes, slightly spicy, citrus, floral, some lemongrass. Fruity yeasty flavor, spicy, citrus, grapes, lemongrass notes, slightly herbal. Very nice american belgian beer.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Hazy golden with a white head. 
Sweetish, peppery aroma with citrus. 
Rather light body B
More sweetish citrus in the flavour; yuzu.
Very nice belgian single. Not too heavy. Light spices, light sour notes. Flavors linger nicely for long finish.

750 mL bottle listed as Brett Devo. Shared by Tcon. Thanks! Cloudy bright orange pour with a ton of foam head. Orange fruit, hops, and brett aroma. Super dry, brett throughout, dusty orange finish. Overall unique, and very enjoyable. Good complimenting hops and brett. Solid.

Bottle from beers of Europe. Great beer. Hazy golden colour with a white aroma yeasty funk fruity, and floral with a touch of bread. Taste light sweet and yeasty, so drinkable. This one with the amazing CHVRCHES, set on TVs from Glasto 2016.

Bottle a long time ago as part of a blind tasting. Just found the notes. They read as follows: "This looks gross. Murky, no head, looks almost brown. Aroma: citrus, sweetness, candy. Taste is super muted. Dry, and lacking any kind of interesting flavor. Not good."   I assume we just had a bad bottle ... will rerate next time a glass ends up in front of me.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow pour with a fluffy white head. Brett aroma. Brett dominates the taste. Not overly complex but tasty. Average body and mouthfeel.Earlier Rating: 4/10/2013 Total Score: 3.9Bottle.  Hazy yellow pour with a huge white head.  Light grassy aromas.  Light and fluffy with mellow lemon, biscuit, grass, and mild brett notes.  Decent body and balance.  Easy drinking and refreshing.

Bottle at home. Aroma is fruity, apricot, barnyard funk, tart fruits, hops, bready malt, spicy yeast. Flavour is light sweet and bitter with a dry finish. Body is medium. Ridiculously smooth and balanced, typical Lost Abbey quality, great Saison-ish Belgian Ale.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, Belgian yeast, orange, hops and brettanomyces.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque golden/amber beer with a medium off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, Belgian yeast and orange; ends slightly bitter, dry and sour with hops and brettanomyces.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Has all the aspects a Belgian Ale needs to have, but with mire hops. The Lost Abbey always manages to perfectly balance their beers.

Just a flat bottle i Hope. No aroma but little hint of sweet per, some acidity but not so strong. Flavour of some pear, but very light and a little punch of green bitterness like fresshy Grass. Thin body, watery mouthfeel, not a good one for sure.

12.7 oz corked and caged bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. 2013 vintage at 6.66% ABV. Hazy bright golden orange with half a finger of off-white head. Aromas of Brett and funk, tropical and stone fruit, herbs. Tastes of earthy funk, Brett, light tropical and stone fruit, herbs. Medium-light body with a very dry finish. Pretty nice.

Clear golden color with a small off-white head fading away. Aroma has a lot of farmhouse funk, really earthy. Taste is quite simple compared to the aroma. Its somehow earthy, with strong olive notes but not much else. Slightly bitter on the aftertaste but not really dry. Not bad but the beer lacks some flavors and complexity. Also the carbonation is almost missing.

Pours a very cloudy, pale golden orange color with visible carbonation bubbling up and a two finger pillowy white head that sticks around forever. Really good retention only slowly fading into a lasting cap. Looks to be over carbonated. 

Prominent musty brett aroma with farmhouse yeast, grass, straw and light fruit. Very earthy and funky with wild bugs overpowering almost everything else. Theres a touch of floral hops and light fruit but the brett dominates. 

Medium body and very over carbonated taking away from the mouthfeel and flavor. Lots of dry, musty funk with the brett overpowering almost everything enjoyable about the base beer. Nice to have a little of this complimenting the farmhouse yeast but its way too strong for my liking. Decent amount of bread/yeast flavor underneath along with grass, straw, faint peppery spice and light fruit. Once the palate adjusts to strong brett presence, the yeast, spice, apple, pear and alcohol flavors come out. Not a bad beer but overcarbed and a bit one dimensional.

Aroma: Sour, yeast, floral and light citrus.
Palate: Light body.
Flavor: Sour, bitter, Finishes with a long, mild bitterness on the back of the tongue. 
Comment: Bland, a bit simple at this point.

2013 bottle - did I store too long? nice aroma; hazy orange pour. Taste was mild and really not pleasing; not nasty just not something I want to drink. Grassy funk; drying toward end some bitterness and I got a peppery spice also.  meh

Cloudy orange color with foam layer. The smell is malty sourish with a milky touch (on second smell: ahoi brause). The taste is super mild with a silky mouth feeling, wrong yeast notes and spicy peppery parts. The aftertaste is calm and mild. My problem with this beer is, that this is too mild and it looses a lot of intensity. This beer might be edgy, but is cut back to much. I am a bit disappointed.

Vintage 2013. Pops hugely when opening, hazy orange color with huge white head. Aroma is fresh, bretty, grapes, lemony. Taste is lemony, a bit biscuity malts, lemon zests, spicy yeasts. Refreshing and well-balanced. I like it, feels like a nice Saison.

Bottle. Fruity aroma with spices, yeast funkiness and tropical fruits. In taste similar, with more grapes in flavour. Low body, dry and crisp with low bitterness and bretts in the finish. Easy drinkable, nice.

Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. A hazy golden coloured beer that pours with a huge rocky white head. It has a spicy lemon and vanilla flavour with gentle barnyard and biscuit notes followed by a zesty herbal and citrus finish. Excellent!

Bottle. Sharp, almost smoky, sort of funk, burnt rubber. Medium gold straw color. Thin fruity initial, light Brett, harsh funky fruitiness in mid palate, and then a drop off in flavors and it flattens. Interesting but kind of disappointing for what should be a special brew. Flavors thin out too quickly and the harsh, phenolic notes detract in a beer that is this light bodied.
Bottle. Funky brett nose, a bit lactic, peaches,grapefruit. Orange-gold, hazy, with lace. Very funky flavor, harsh, hay, thinner. Very disappointing flavor.

Grumlig gyllene huve. Små bubblor. Dåligt med skum. Humlig smak(typiskt USA) & massa brettajäst. En viss trevlig maltsötma infinner sig. Medelfyllig kropp. Tyvärr är doften i just denna flasköl väldigt liten. Känner en viss bretta. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from brewdogpours hazy pale blonde with dense white head. Typical weisse-like notes, Spicey yeast esters on nose, full bodied, spritzy carbonation, slightly tart with some developing Brett character but very subtle. Only 6 months old at the moment, needed longer.
Excellent spicy and balanced banana aroma. Flavor of some breads yeast and light Brett. Some Belgian Candy sugar and very slight banana nut in flavor as well. Woody finish.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with big frothy brett head which last a long time. Aroma is really juicy. Only slight yeast, spices, tropical fruits and pineapple. Some fruity funk in there. Some bread grains as well. Taste is similar to the nose. Juicy grapes and fruity yeast. Some citrus and bretty grape as well as slight grains. High carbonation and super dry and crisp mouthfeel. Slight spicy finish. Really drinkable!

75cl bottle at home. Almost transparant golden colour, white foamy head. Belgian yeasty banana, some spiciness and nice creamy malts reminiscent of a (light) Belgian triple, faint citrus hoppy notes and a very light hint of brett funk, without real acidity. Very well balanced. Low carbonation, medium body. Expected some more brett tones from this.

1 pint 9.4 fl oz bottle. Golden amber colour, frothy white foam head and aroma of fruity, banana, yeast, funky. Taste is sourish with malt caramel, grain, apricot fruity, funk and spicey earthy pithy bitterness. Light to medium bodied, fine carbonation, dry lingering bitter finish. Nicely drinkable.

Une couche de mousse moyenne mais durable se pose sur une bière aux teintes orangées et très marécageuse. Un bouquet à la fois fruité où des oranges sont notamment détectées, et funky titille les sens. Cette sensation fruitée est décuplée en bouche; les mandarines, tangerines et oranges sanguines sont jumelées à un aspect sauvage léger, mais bien assumé. La carbonatation est un peu trop intense, à mon avis, mais nempêche que cette bière, même si la bouteille datait un peu, est superbe.

Bottle 37,5cl / Botella 37,5cl.
@ Maquila Bar.
A: Light amber / Ambar claro.
T/S: Yeast, sour, slightly fruity / Levadura, agrio, ligeramente afrutado.
Bottle at Seattle Share. Part of the blind brett saison tasting. Pretty still, small head. Cloudy orange, juicy sour. odd yeasty note. Grapefruit, floaties. Dry finish. Ok.
Color yellow with a lot of carbonation some bitterness but at a low level some acidity. Not too fruity and not so much flavor. Not so much else than the brett.

Really bubbly dark yellow pour with swirls of white on top. Aroma of sweet berries, grapes, pert estery funk, sweet fresh cut hay. Lively carbonation, velvett mouthfeel, dry finish. Flavors of straw, grain, lemon peel, barnyard funk, soapy yeast maybe. Overall kind of light, straightforward funk, bitter finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a tulip glass.
Aroma- Has a strong fruit aroma, very pleasing.
Appearance- this is a murky orange color with a small white head. looks great
Taste- the fruit flavor really comes through, very nice
Palate- A medium bodied beer with moderate to heavy carbonation has a great crisp feel.
Overall- A wonderful beer, must try.

from Au Trappiste - cloudy dark blond beer under a giant foamy head; light cheesy with fair fruity notes of lichies and apples; full-bodied, gently sour, quite dry and with a long fruity and funky finish
750ml bottle ... Gold straw ... Solid foam .. . Straw, hay, fresh straw, and bretty leaves .. Mild mouth, and a quaffer .. . . This beer tasting is terrible, so lovely and fresh

375ml corked bottle. Belgian yeast aroma with sour Brett funk and apple notes. Pours cloudy, light golden colored with a large soapy white head with good retention and not much lacing. Starts with a plethora of flavors including straw, barnyard funk, lemongrass, citrus, and candi sugar. Finishes extremely bitter and sour with lots of funky Brett that lingers on the palate. Pretty good, but the finish is a bit harsh for my tastes.

2008 Bottling
From notes. Tasted on 1/27/13 from a corked and caged 750mL bottle that I had obtained in a trade some time before. Pours a hazy but bright orange with a thin white head that leaves very thin lace. The nose is spicy saison yeast with a bit of bread malt, tons of brett funk, honey, and a lightly fruity aroma. The flavor is dry and funky, lightly fruity, nice honey, and plenty of spicy saison with some light bitterness. The body is medium with some tannin and a long super funky and spicy yeasty finish.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a goblet on 06.01.14.

A: Cloudy orange with yeast. 1/2 finger white head.

S: Mandarin orange, apple juice, cherry and red grape. Very sweet and fruity.

T: Pear, apple, cherry, banana, and bubblegum dominate. Funk, chalk, and candy are more subtle.

M: Crisp, bubbly, dry, and chewy.

O: This was an amazingly complex belgian pale ale. I dont normally like sour or funky beers, but this one is excellent. I probably liked this one because the funk is not overpowering, but is slight and adds to the complexity on the back end.

[6306-20140502] Bottle. Light orange pineapple fruity grains aroma. Hazy, pale orange body with a quick palmy white head. Light orange lemon fruity flavour. Medium body. Mild and drinkable. (7/3/7/3/15) 3.5
(w/ blankboy, GregClow, jercraigs)
bottle. very hazy golden with one finger head. strong carbonation. very yeasty with quite a bit of brett presence, though far more funky than anything sour. Some fruitiness as well.

Bottle from my secret santa 2013. Pours clear golden with a small creamy white head. Fruity funky aroma, sweet malty with earthy notes. Taste is light sweet, with funky notes, wood and herbs, all well mixed together,weak dry herbal finish. Very good, refreshing, high carbonated beer.

750ml bottle at home shared with friends. Pale orange with a full slightly off-white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Medium sweet and bitter tones. Citrus, tart, spices, hay, grass and herbs. The brett really adds something to the original brew, great beer.
Hazy orangeish colour, white head. Aroma is fruits, wood some floral and stuff. Flavour is some fruity and hoppy notes with quite much yeastiness.
Sampled during RBSG. From notes. Grassy lemon notes, orange citrus and a hint of funk.

Cobrizo pálido y ligeramente tupido con una densa y generosa capa de espuma blanca. Aromas de fruta verde, pan y uva. Cuerpo medio y redondo, con inicio afrutado con acidez moderada que recuerda la ciruela verde y la uva, final seco. Excelente.
Corked 66 cl bottle @ home. Pours hazy golden with some sediment and a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are brett, lemons, yeast, and pepper - with a dry finish.
Bottle @dutchdrebus birthday. Golden color with a big off-white head. Smells malty, sweet, some hops, caramel. Tastes yeast, malts, caramel and some herbs.

Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear golden with a thin white head. Aromas are grassy, lemon, pepper. Taste is dry and light sweet. Finishes a bit thin. Expected something a bit more special to be honest. Pretty standard.
Bottle. Golden with white head. Aroma of brett, pineapple, fruity snd dusty. Taste of caramel, Pineapple, caramel. Bit boring.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear golden, nose is toffee, funky, taste is light funk, sweet, dry.
bottle at home ... golden yellow ... big white heaad ... soft fruits .peppery lemon nosse ... soft salty fruits ... juivcy fruit s.. salty fruits ... light dry fruit finish

Serving: Bottle. Cloudy amber orange pour with a pillowy white head. Light citrus, brett, grass, grain, and a touch of stone fruit on the nose. Nicely complex on the tongue with some dusty yeast, hay, grass, and a touch of grain. Very dry on the finish. Very good stuff.

Flaska från SB. Gyllenfärgad, disig med högt vitt skum. doft av camenbert och brett. Frisk, örtig, lätt men funkig brett, blommor, kryddor. Jag tänker på en gammal orval. Så bra balans, rena fina smaker, frisk lätt. Fantastiskt god.

On tap at the Forge. Appearance: finger white head, straw yellow, cloudy, good lacing. Aroma: orange, brett, leather, funky apple. Palate: average carbonation, light body, light bitter finish. Taste: good fruit sweetness into a light fruit funk from the brett, then into a light floral bitterness. Overall, good balance, great tastes, and balance is great.

Shared 750 ml. bottle poured to snifters, showing a hazed, orangey gold color, with a frothy, white layer of head foam, and ribbons & spots of clingy lacing. The nose was lightly floral, with a negligible Brett scent, light grain & esters. The taste was similar, with a moderate hop bitterness, decent carbonation, light tartness, and a dry, crisp finish. A year cellared, 12.7 oz. bottle was brought out next to compare. Lacing was more as spots, and less dramatic, yeasty funk was more pronounced, and the effervescence was a bit lower. Both were equally flavorful.

"More similar to the saison-like base beer than some crazy wild sour ale. Just hints of funk and grass on the nose and a pleasant tartness on the palate. I thought Id dig this, and I did. Nice dry, grassy finish. 2014 more tropical fruity hop goodness than the first time. Even better."

Golden orange with a small pale head. Aroma is candied citrus peel, stone fruits, touch of brett funk, herbal honey, white grape must. Light-medium bodied, funky on the palate with a touch of bitterness towards the end. Taste is grapefruit and lemon peel, melon rind, peach pit, grape skins, sage. Interesting

Cloudy amber good with a thin white head. Aroma is tart fruit with a hint of bready yeast. Tart up front with a dry finish. Fairly effervescent with a little tingly bitterness.

Wife: 4.2
2013 bottle ..Pour is golden white head..Nose is nice brett esters, grassy hop, spice, apricot..Taste is spice, some bitterness, grassy hop, earth..very nice on a hot day.

Bottle: Cork came off with nary a pop. Sad feels. Yep, the pour reveals very, very poor head formation. No real head at all, really, just some meager, gray bubbles that surface & vanish in just a few moments. Oily looking beer; fuzzy, opaque, & dense peach in color. Aroma is full of ripe orange flesh, pineapple, brettanomyces, mild barnyard hay, cork, Bazooka Joe bubblegum, wheat, & a touch of lemon-lime. Taste is a little less sweet, more earthy-bitter with noticeable hops, florals, & some heavy spice from the Belgian yeast. Brett in the form of damp hay, light barnyard floor, & musty cotton. Small bit of orange & lemon zest in the finish with more Belgian yeast esters, faint clove, & gum. Mouth feel is slightly oily & also disappointing thanks to the apparently lack of carbonation. Some snap would do this one well. Not a bad beer, but I feel like this had so much more potential. Dammit Tomme.

Poured from the tap into a tasting glass.

The color is a cloudy orange with a brownish tint with a finger of foamy white head and some lacing.

The smell is pretty bretty, some barnyard type flavor that is mixed with a bit of green apple and a little bit of honey as well with the constant touch of funk.

The taste is less funky then expected but does have a smooth mellow barnyard flavor. Some fruit flavor is mixed into the sourness with some green apple and a little pear. There is also some spicy flavor that is pleasant and not overpowering.

The feel of this beer is medium bodied and goes down with a nice drinkable feel. It is slightly refreshing and holds a funky character that stays throughout.
Bottle @ 2nd Tuesday tasting. Aroma is grassy hay funk, light malt. Flavour is very dry, quite hoppy, fruits and herbal, light note of spices. Nice.

faint golden, with a thick head. Quite earthy, funky aroma, faint hints of freshly cut field and apples. Very dry on the tongue, high acidity. Body is light to medium, texture is slick, lively almost fizzy carbonation. Also quite zesty. Brett character is obvious but very balanced. This is quite the beer! Awesome stuff from Lost Abbey yet again.
Wine-like saison, with a taste of tardy fruit, dry hops and the warm depth that a barrel aged beer on something like port often has. Complex and diverse, quite good.

Bottled @ de Molen tasting, small sample. Hazy yellow to golden color, medium white head. Aroma of spicy yeast, bit citrus, some coriander, grassy hop, bit grainy malt. Just the slightest funky note, more peppery, and definitely not Brett character you would expect. Medium bitter in taste, slight sweetness, quite dry. Medium carbonation, low to medium bodied. Wonderful balance, and although the Brett character could be more pronounced imo, still a very likeable beer.

Sample at the Molen monthly tasting.
thick creamy white head. Clear golden pour. Nice and drinkable

Bottle shared at the De Molen monthly tasting. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma is a little funky, barnyard, Brett character coming out, weeds, citrus and herbal aspects. Flavor is light moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Medium bodied with light carbonation.

Fräsigt bryggeri men dessa sura saker är inte min kopp te alls. Men snygg öl för övrigt

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour is transparent golden amber with a tight fluffy off white head. Nose is lime, green apple, and tropical fruit. Taste is fairly clean, strong lime with some tropical fruit notes. Brett presence is faint, slightly Cobb webby, with a hint of underlying grain. Carbonation is fairly strong, body is pretty light.

Bottle. Hazy golden body. Frothy white head, lasting. Aroma of horse blanket, lacquer, toasted grain, lemon, cobwebs, floral hops, soil. The flavor is lightly to moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. It finishes lightly sweet and moderately bitter. Medium body, watery turning velvety texture, lively carbonation. Dry finish. The brett is nicely balanced to it does not overwhelm the citrus and other characteristics of the beer. Good stuff.

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2014 355ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden amber, with a small off-white head, which lasts reasonably well and leaves decent lacing. Oak, leather and grapefruit are backed by a decent level of sourness to create the aroma. It is quite sour up front, with (oddly) some strawberry notes coming through. Light malt sweetness, oak and leather come into the mid-palate, with a nicely sour finish. All in all a highly enjoyable sour. I should note that on a previous tasting this rated a 0.9 and one of my very few sink pours ever, as it was totally flat and undrinkable. This bottle came from the same lot at the same shop, so it was not a BBD issue, which suggests to me that quality control at this brewery needs tightening up.

375 ml corked and caged bottle purchased at Beverage Warehouse in Los Angeles 14 months ago ($6.99). Pours a hazy yellow-amber color with a giant four+ fingers of fluffy white foam. AROMA of musty damp basement, white wine, lemon, apple, Asian pear / nashi, wheaty malts, with hints of spice. FLAVOR has an initial big funky Brett bite followed by notes of lemon, tart green apple peel, pear, lemongrass, some bready malts, and spicy yeast. Relatively light bodied with generous carbonation that adds to the flavor and mouthfeel. I like how the Brett is certainly there and noticeable but not overpowering. (349, 879)
Bottle. RBSG Grand Tasting. Pours cloudy yellow with white head. Nose/taste of lemon, peppercorn, cake malt and grass. Medium body.

Appearance: slightly cloudy bright gold; one finger of creamy, bright white head and good lacing.  Aroma: champagne, honey, light pineapple and peach, white pepper, lemon zest, slightly sharp brett funk.  Taste: bittersweet pineapple, mango, peach, light banana, Belgian yeast, decent barnyard funk.  Finish: sweetness increases as it warms, adding honey smacks cereal to the fruity, yeasty funk.  Notes:  Bottle from the Rare Beer Club, shared during Beerble Study. Darn good Belgian ale, with the Brett used as a nice addition to the flavor profile. Incredibly drinkable, with a zippy, zesty palate.

Bottle - 750mL corked and caged from The Rare Beer Club. Hazy gold pour with a medium, foamy white head. Fruity and yeasty nose with doughy malt, biscuit notes, dried fruits, floral notes and grass. Taste is bready malt, toasted grains, yeast, dried fruits, grass, floral hops and soft herbal notes. Body is medium with a strong, bubbly carbonation. Ends with more fruit, yeast, floral hosp, toasted malt, bread notes, grass, and citrusy zest.

Hazy yellow orange pour with a fluffy white that slowly fades to film. Aroma is spicy Belgian yeast, peach, and light barnyard. Taste has a peach and pineapple fruitiness with spice, slightly herbal notes, and subtle dusty funky brett. Soft palate. Brett is not in your face but is an excellent compliment. Really good beer.
Hazy straw golden with big shaving cream head. Nose is fresh pineapple brett. Taste is medicinal and bretty, light and bubbly and finishes with a bit sourness.

Bottle from brewery. Pours golden with an inch of white foam. Leaves a lot of lacing in the glass. Kind of sweet on the nose. Nice use of Brett here. Its not a sour bomb but instead it complements the perfumed Belgian ale aspect of the beer with a nice tartness on the finish. Nice.

Hazy golden body w/ an off-white head. Aroma of champagne & barnyard funk. Dry fruity flavors finish dry & tart. Brett presence at end. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
One of my fav TLA brews...spicy phenolic aroma great notes of fruity mango pineapple hay...everything yeasty kitchen sink...BUT real well balanced!!!!!!! Taste and finsh equally as great!!!

Sharp clean straw gold pour with two fingers of crackling white head. bretty/funky nose, lots of pineapple and tropical fruits with spicy and peppery notes and a lightly mousey/bandaid character. very peppery and spicy in the flavor with a barnyard note and band aid quality. Very light and dry body with a full carbonation and spicy finish.

[Bottle (12.7oz) shared with GregClow, jercraigs & mabel -- c/o j&m] Pours a slightly hazy gold with an average size semi-lasting frothy white head. Nice bretty aroma along with citrus, herbs, some light sourness and grassiness. Flavour is also bretty and herbal, and quite drinkable. Average to medium bodied. I really liked this.

375 ml bottle. Deep golden with small white head. Aroma fresh and nice, lemon peel, orange, wheat and some faint perfumy notes. Taste is very well balanced, strong wheat notes, faint barnyard and a finishing bitterness. Very nice

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2014 This one was fun. The aromas of banana, yeast, lemon, pineapple, clove, bubble gum, light tropical fruits, scuppernong grapes, and a light, beautiful funk blew me away. The flavors were bread, grains, funk, and banana up front. The middle played around with clove and other spices, and there seemed to be a kick of earthy hops right before the finish melded into a bitter grapefruit flavor. My beer guy suggested I try this as a bridge into Saisons... Long story short, now im into Saisons...

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2014 2014-05-02. Crisp dark yellow body with a modest off-white head and lace. Gets pretty hazy with the bottom of the bottle added. 3+ Aroma is pleasant, grassy straw and hay with light bretty funk overtones. Whisper of sweet lemon. 7+ Flavour is relatively mild, pale lightly biscuity malt core. Light bitterness, lingering light funk long into the finish and aftertaste. Average plus bodied palate, moderate carbonation. Relatively simple but quite enjoyably quaffable. Bottle via trade with BoostIPA

Appearance was cloudy gold with lasting creamy white 2 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are floral tart fruits, green olive juice, musk, slight malt sweetness. Taste are soft sweet malts upfront gives way to tart lemon, orange, slight vinegar acid, dough and funk. Palate was high CO2 with light- medium body, lasting tangy Brett and fruity finish. A weird one to pin down with the Bretts, dont quite understand them yet.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2014 Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a huge off white pillowy head that slowly dissipates leaving clumpy lacing on the glass. Aroma is funky, Brett, wet towels, grass, peppercorns. Flavor is light sweet and a bit fruity, lots of Brett funkiness, some lemon zest bitterness and a bit of acidic sharpness as well. Dry but fruity finish. Medium body, too damn much carbonation - let it sit for a while and settle down. Re-evaluate with a 2012 bottle from Cocoapuph - pretty nice, nice Bretty funk remains. Carbonation much more under control. At least a 3.8 for this one.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours hazy golden with a large white large bubble head. Nice aroma of ripe and funky fruit, orange, hay, barnyard, grass. Taste is medium sweet with orange, some barnyard funky notes, light bitter. Finish is ripe fruit and barnyard.

Vintage 2013 A. Pours a cloudy golden orange from the bottle with thin lacy white head that leaves good lace. Aroma is nice funky brett awesomeness, barnyard funk, earth, and apricots with hints of sour. Taste falls a bit flat of the nose, kind of like an overly malted saison, Bit of a burn on the way down even though the booze isnt that high, bit of a metallic finish, medium carbonation. At least its one of their cheaper offerings.

Poured from bottle picked up at Hy Vee, shelf whale bros, pours a hazy golden orange with a thin white head, aroma is of citrus lots of funk with a kick of hops too, flavor is a let down compared to the arom, light fruit and a hint of funk in the finish, carbonation was very light and really not even there, really meh, what a let down.

From Shane. Thanks! 

A: Beautiful gold color with an active foamy white head that dies down into a 1/2" with good retention. Good bubbles. Some lacing. 

N: Lemon rind and grapefruit. Esters and tropic thunders. Caramel and tangerine. Lots of grass, and the brett is giving this a horse grain/blanket sensation. White wine/grape/chardonnay.

T: Slight sourness, some bitterness, and plenty of grainy sweetness. Hits the tongue with softness - very enjoyable. 

M: Very dry, medium body, sparkling carbonation. 

O: This is very pleasant. Champagne-like in its carbonation and its roundness, and the Brettanomyces have dried this out without overpowering it with horse blanket funk. Wish this would go into wide distro so I could obtain cases of it.
Bottle. Lightly hazy golden hay yellow. White grape, hay, slight earth and vanilla in the aroma. Flavor is hay, vanilla, slight spice, grass and citrus. Lighter body with vibrant carbonation.

Une belle petite bouteille avec un bouchon de liège. Vintage 2013. Un liquide au couleur de jus de pomme non-filtré. Un nez de malt blond, de petites fleurs blanches et de brett. En bouche le liquide est ligneux, il goûte le bois blanc. Cest sèche et astringent. Les bretts sont bien présents.

37.5 cl. Une bière jaune marécageuse. Un col mousseux plein de microbes. Un nez qui déborde de levure. Des bretts bien intégrées. Un aspect végétal joué par des conifères et des fleurs. Une base épicée de blé et de céréales pâles. Du citron ou du pamplemousse. Un goût intense mais aimable. Des houblons, des levures, des céréales et des fruits qui expulsent des saveurs aigres et bien amères. Une sensation en bouche des plus légères. Très pétillante et mince. Une finale assez persistante avec une sécheresse terreuse et poivrée. Un point de plus pour sa grande buvabilité.

375ml bottle served in a tulip. Pours opaque cloudy pale orange with thick stiff off-white head. Aroma is sweet mild Belgian candi sugar, cut late on the palate with floral citrusy tartness. Taste is earthy medium pale malt, oddly none of the sweetness from the nose is noticable. Finishes dry with a light grassy, earthy sour notes. Finish is clean and dry. Not a standout really, particularly for Lost Abbey, but a pleasant very drinkable beer.

Aroma is mandarin oranges, very mild funk, brett is definitely present, sour.
Taste is med to heavy, surprising for this kind of beer. Thick sweetness due to the light carbonation, lemon lime. Wood. Very limey. Grapefruit.
I would like to lay this down for 8 to 12 months. This could be really fun if the lemon lime edge was rounded out a bit.

Poured into a snifter from corked and caged 375ml. Smells, like bitter funk, banana peel, peach cobbler. Some nice legs for a hoppy saison, clings to the glass with a dissipating eggshell white head. Muddy, hazy light orange color. Definitely get hop bitterness right of the bat, some floral notes and dried papaya and mango, but wow is this thing funky on the bitter end of the spectrum. I prefer a little more tartness and fruit in my brett beer. Definitely unique, be interested to see what time does to the brett in here. Crisp and enjoyable.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Pours yellow to orange with a nice head, aroma of brett, olives fruits, fresh with some apples, flavor is sourish, olives, fruits, hoppy, medium bodied

Bottle: Cloudy, golden, medium to thick head with great lace although the bubble size is a little course. Rich, estery, fruit all with just a hint of funk. Not dominated by animal. Orange rind. Just a little sour. Hint of that aroma profile from Cuvee at Bear Republic, Chemical or spice!! Guess thats just another bretty aroma. Dry, slightly sour and moderate to medium high bitterness. Dense and long. High carbonation and probably bottle conditioned. Layered palate. Funky. Cross between a Belgium all and farmhouse ale. Orange liqueur and rind.
had everything I wanted accept flavour, really underwhelming. Was wanting more intense flavours. Nice colour, aroma and head - nice warming alcohol.
375ml bottle pours hazy golden yellow with a finger of head. Nose is fruity funky yeast and grainy citrus. Taste is weird funk and plastic, cereal, some orange. Strange plastic finish. Awful.

375 ml bottle from Homer321- thanks again! 2013 vintage. Pours a hazy peach color with a huge eggshell colored head that laces the glass heavily and sticks. Aroma of bretty funk, lemon, apricot, tangerine, light florals, and lemon candy. Flavor of bready malts, bretty funk, straw, cereal, orange citrus, and florals. Light-medium bodied, with medium carbonation and a bready, funky, citrusy mouthfeel. Really nice.

1/26/2014. Vintage 2013. Pours cloudy golden yellow with a thin white head. Funky, fruity flavors, bit of bready and barnyard aromas. Flavors are tart, fruity with the yeast and Brett showing well. Medium to high carbonation with a long and bitter finish.

2013 bottle drunk on 1/25/14Incredibly frothy white head, is very well retained and tops a brassy, clear body, with sediment left behind. Lazy bubbles rising.Brett in the nose! Sure, but whats more is some biscuity malt and some lightly spicy hops. But mostly its the tart acids. Very nice. Moderate to high strength of aroma.Pure band-aids and hickory skin in the flavor. Really well-attenuated, thankfully, without any malt heaviness. This is approaching orval, but for the hops. That being said, the brett is absolutely stunning. So well done its succulent and almost sugary in its depth. A study in brett brut? Sure, why not. Very peppery carbonation but as it breathes its still quite tight and engaging. Simple, with pilsner malts and pale malts adding just the right amount of sugar, while the brett does all the work. Im thinking one more year in the bottle, kept slightly warm and this should be absolutely stunning.

375ml bottle, 2013 vintage.
Pours a slightly cloudy medium gold, with a firm white head.
Spicy, funky aroma, malt, brett, citrus, grass, hay, dried fruits, peaches, earth, wood (?).
Dry, medium bodied, mid to high bitterness, creamy CO2.
Spicy, funky, slightly acidic taste, citrus, grass, earth, apricot, spruce, hops, wood.
Quite complex, very rich and full flavoured. However, the alcohol is very evident, and leaves the palate with a very metallic, burning, bitter feeling. But thats a minor detail, the complexity of the flavours and the overall balance is still impressive. Very nice, on the whole. (2014-01-25)

Pours a cloudy peach color with a loose head of large, soapy bubbles - nose is a mix of sweet melon, light honeysuckle, along with some crackery gingerbread and pineapple Brett and light muskiness - moderate carbonation - light sweetness up front, but the flavor is mostly dry from middle to finish, with some gingerbread, pineapple, funky peach skin - finish of mustiness and dry basement yeast notes - a nice Brett beer.

January 18, 2014 - bottle from Binnys. Cloudy orange pour with lots of head and some lacing. Aroma and taste were nicely balanced with the yeast, spice, citrus and brett. Slightly dry finish and some carbonation.

Bottle - thanks Folty! Hazy rich yellow golden pour with a huge pure white head. Awesome citrus and Brett aroma. Taste is citrus and lightly sweet, crisp and medium palate. Really good! Finishes slightly dry.

Bottle from 2d2dspuma online store. Color is dark gold and head is huge! Body is thin and carbonation is soft and belgianish. Taste is medium bitter, low sweet and medium sour. Aroma is brett (nice!), caramel, spices, fruity, winish and cellarish.

Small head misty deep gold pour medium carbonation aromas the brett note smooth sweet malt spice fruit the tastes fizzy note citrus mix caramel brett not strong just enough to have some influence on the ale pepper ginger touches dry note honey and the finish best tastes the sweetness coming from hops and malt yeast is smooth good balance spice dryness okay ale

Bottle. Aroma is sour and hoppy. Appearance is a hazy golden with a frothy white head. Taste is a lot more malty than I expected. The malt has the sour sting mixed with the carbonation and the finish leans toward sour but is more malty. Palate is very neutral. Overall, and interesting brew. Would have liked to had one that had been kept room temp.

375 picked up at Bier Thirty in Bown right around Christmas. Finally getting down to opening it tonight. 3 finger foamy white head... great retention... the bubbles gradually form big bubbles that stick around forever... crusty lacing... the brew is pretty clear golden... very bubbly.

Brett, floral perfume, and tons of citrus zest... something that I am having a hard time identifying, almost tropical with a sharp minty/grassy element.

Flavor is much better integrated... lite pale maltiness with approachable brett... again a bit of floral notes move into cut hay/grass... much more drinkable than the aroma let on.

Light/medium body with a pretty good carbonation.... The aroma is pretty sharp, but the flavor makes this one pretty drinkable.

Pours darker yellow with huge head and lastin glace. Aroma is bubblegum, banana, intense Brett, big sweet corn. Flavor is quite sweet, astringent, yeasty, bitter herbal end. Intense feel, slick and thick. Very good beer!

This the way I like Brett, not in your face like many other beers. A fruity farmhouse frames this beer.Hazy and opaque cloudy golden with an off-white head. Aroma of yeast and Brett. Creamy on the tongue. Light body, dry sweet grapefruit and yeast with dry and slightly astringent Brett accents. A little yeast and dry, astringent phenols in the finish. Very pleasing and refreshing piece of work.
Poured from the bottle it has a golden color with a large head. Aroma of malt, yeast and mild fruit. Taste has some brett with fruit, yeast and an earthiness to it. Good finish.

Great brett aroma and an amazing golden color. Flavor is disappointingly bland. Beer is average w just slight brett kick. Like a watered down orval.

Botled. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head.Aroma of brett, yeast, caramel spicy notes and a little hops too. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry with bitter notes. Light to medium bodied, watery flavor and soft carb. A nice brew indeed.
A definite funk that you need to ready for. A nice citrus flavor that quickly becomes barnyard and hay. Finishes smooth, a nice Lost Abbey for my first.

Bottle 12,7oz brought back from Denver. Last beer for 2013! Almost impossible to get the cork off, but still it released with a loud pop and good smoke. No gusher though. Pours a clear golden beer with a big white head on top. Aroma of fruity yeast approaches you when the bottle is opened and the beer is poured. Also some barnyard and saison-like characters. Missing the pepper, or else the aroma would suit a saison perfectly. Flavor is yeast, typical Belgian but with an American twist to it. Some hops are detected, giving it a slight bitter touch in the aftertaste. Prickly mouthfeel, easy drinking and very enjoyable. Nice beer to close off 2013 and start a new, terrific beer year...
Bottle. Golden -orange colour with a white head. Aroma is yeast, hop, grain. Flavour yeast, hop, grain, hop, brett, lemon, orange. Nice beer.

A hazed golden amber ale with a thick frothy off white head. In aroma, beautiful sweet fruity malt with light Brett notes, light pepper, Orval character, very nice. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with light Brett, perfumy, earthy, well done, but 16.99$ is a bit much.
Bottle from bevmo, san francisco. Hazy orange color, white head. Aroma is sour fruits, yeast, berries. Sour taste, fruits, hops, some yeast.
Pour is golden with huge white full head. Aroma is hay, fruit, funk. Taste is bitter funk, hay, citrus, fruit and slightly dry.

Beauty of a little brett brew here. Bit of tropical fruits on the nose combined with a touch of brett and barnyard. Flavors are straw and grass with a very polite brett splash, hints of cracker towards the finish. Really delightful!
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy golden with a big and lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity and bretty. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 111213

Bottle @ Christers. Pours dark yellow with a small white head. Aroma of light malt, light sourness, brett, wood, light spicy, cinnamon. Flavor is malt, brett, wood, little sour, fruity, light spice. Medium body, lively carbonation. 111213
Bottle. Clear golden with big white head. Aroma is malt, fruit and brett. Flavour is malt, fruit, brett, little dry, little sweet, little ananas‎, hop and a little bitter.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are brett, yeast, straw, fruits, malt and hops. Nice and funky.

375ml bottle. Cloudy orangey golden colour with huge, thick, frothy, fully lasting, moderately lacing, white head. Intense Brett aroma, bubblegum, long drop, urinal cake. Taste is dry, bretty, subtle sweetness; lively carbonation. Simply Brett, simply good.

Bottle. Thanks to adnielsen for sending. Pours a clear golden color with big white head. Light barnyard, brett, hay aromas. Kind of light flavor and aroma. Slight tart, hay, citrus, cracker flavors. I?m surprised by the lighter the aroma and flavor. Maybe this beer has a little too much age on it?

Bottle @ Beer & Ball Saturday, Odense. 13,000th Tasting. Pours cloudy yellow with an fluffy egg white head. Bretty dry nose. Some farmhouse, barnyard, grass and a whiff of citrus. Smooth and dry. Tasty and quite elegant.

Odense Beer & Ball Saturday - Nigeria-Denmark World Cup 1998. Hazy pale golden with a big white head. Funky aroma of leather, pineapple and grapefruit. Dry and funky flavour with lots of herbal and grassy hops and a quite bitter finish. Quite Orval-like but with a fruitier brett character
Bottle @ Odense Beer & Ball Saturday. Hazy yellow body with a large white head. Green apples, apple crumble, brett, yeast, hops. Fruity, bitter and yeasty flavour. Bitter end. This is great.

Bottled 375ml PBFVIII
Hazy yellow color, small white head. Light barnyard, tart fruityness. Medium-bodied. Fruity, slightly tart, mango and peach. Grassy hoppyness. Feels like 4% brew.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Cloudy yellowish orange with a huge off-white head. Aroma of some brett, yeast, flowers, fruitiness and mild spiciness. Dry-ish flavor with light sweetness, yeast, mild funk, flowers, some fruitiness and some bitterness in the finish. Medium-bodied.
Color was cloudy orange; poured a huge head. Aroma of funk and yeastiness; garbage. Flavor was funky, yeasty and band aid. Never liked brett.

Bottle; poured a ruddy gold/yellow with a huge white head. Aroma of brett, yeast, wheat, must and fruit. Nice aroma. Flavor was not quite as good. A bit flat overall. Some spicy type notes, brett and yeast. Not too much band aid, but just nothing to get too excited about.

Bottle from BOE, split with JF at the pre 5K tasting, 12/11/13.
Clear golden blonde with a big olde white head.
Nose is bretty, light piss, funk, glue, lemon rind, grassy, floral notes.
Taste is brett forward, dank wood, straw, lemon rind, soured citric notes, hint of soap. 
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, dry brett laden finale.
Decent enough bretty Belgian number but no world beater.

text: 2013 bottle I almost completely missed in Phoenix; glad I looked closer. Also glad Lost Abbey makes the smaller bottles. Pours a cloudy straw-yellow color with tons of carbonation driving a big, white head. Huge aroma of brett, spruce, banana and a hint of soapiness. Tasty with more brett, some earthiness and bitterness. Fairly true to form. Somehow I doubt the 6.66 ABV printed on the bottle is an accident. BTW, the label displayed here doesnt say "Saints" Devotion but the bottle in my hand does.

Appearance: Clear golden color with a off white head.Aroma: Malty, funky yeast and fruity.Palate: Medium body. Tad sweet, and a mild bitterness. Rich carbonation.Taste: Fresh and balanced brett. Acidic fruity, malty and some yeast.Overall impression: Nice one!Personal stats: Bottle @ Geokkjer

Bottle popped on Halloween, 6.66% ABV -- what do you want from me? Solid beer and better with a little age. Pours a cloudy light orange with a solid white head. Smell is similar to a Bretty Belgian. Taste gives you the Brett funk up front, dry and horse-y. Spice, malt, yeast, bitterness all there. Feel like it was sweeter in its earlier days but dont trust my memory more than I do. You can find this for about $6 when its around which probably makes it the best value of all Lost Abbey beers. I buy this one pretty regularly and always enjoy.
Bubbly, champagne-like pour with a light straw color. Some definite funk, with a dry slightly bitter finish. Notes of light fruit. Nice, not exceptionally complex, but very drinkable.
Aroma contains gentle sweet caramel and barnyard/leathery notes. Flavour adds a complex of spiciness, gentle bitterness and even a hint of citrus.
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty aroma. Fruity malty spicy yeasty flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty finish.

Bottle. Pours golden with a big white head. Aroma of funk, malt, some fruitiness, some herbal notes and cellar. Flavor is sweet and funky with malt, herbal notes, some cellar notes and sour berries. medium body, average carbonation.

Mistanke om at den var ødelagt da det var spor af øl i korken. Korken åbner med et smæld. 2-3 fingre skum som lægger sig. Duft af brett, hæst og stald. Lidt kulsyre og smag af æble, brett og gær. Fin øl men heller ikke mere :)
Hazy orange color, moderate head, decent lace/retention. Aroma is brett, funk, fairly fruity, light sugar. Medium bodied, moderate to low funk, balanced nicely.

Bottle to glass. Pours a hazy deep golden light amber color with a massive frothy off-white head. Very lively carbonation. Aroma is a mix of mild yeasty notes with a hint of sour. Flavor is more belgian yeast and less in the sour. Lingering yeasty character in the finish. Decent.

Beautifully carbonated - huge head that stayed in place, with bubbles stacking up under it waiting to push out of the beer. Far funkier than expected, which hits a bit hard on the aroma with odd off scents. Strong off-flavors in the taste also, but those are balanced out quite well by the beer. A nice surprise for a $6 corked bottle.
Sample at the 2013 GABF. Pours a hazy gold with an off white head. Aroma and flavors of white pepper , some banana and feint butterscotch. Tart finish.

Bottle at GABF 2013. Poured a clear light amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is fresh yeast and acid citrus fruit. The flavour is weak watery sour with a weak acid yeast citrus fruit palate. Served cool...super smooth and refreshing.

Gold, weisse schaumkrone, aroma nach bretts, geschmack leicht säuerlich und zitrone, gut ausgewogene malzig- und bitterkeit

375 ml bottle, 2013 vintage- Pours hazy golden with a two finger crackly white head that reduces fairly quickly but never quite goes away. The aroma is strong brett, basement and dust, banana and yeasty. The taste is less funky than the aroma, but brett and banana are the dominant tastes, clove and yeast there too. Good beer, I would have loved to let this sit for a year, but I dont have any patience.

2013 Vintage 375mL bottle.
Aroma is full of Brett fruitiness. Tons of pineapple, tropical fruit and a touch of cherry pie. Light peppery phenolic character. 
Pours a cloudy golden orange with a big pillowy white head with good retention. Medium high lacing and faint legs. 
Flavor is slightly sweet with some citrus character and a light cracker note upfront. Moderately high notes of pineapple, cherry pie and tropical fruit. Moderate spicy phenolic character. Light bitterness and a dry finish.
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with medium high carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Lots of fruity Brett character is very nice but the phenolic character is just a hint soapy. One of my favorite Brett beers on the market and so easily available.

Bottle (375 ml) @ Lord Hobo. Slightly hazy golden/orange with a medium white head and light lacing. Aroma is of brettanomyces, Belgian yeast, fruits, farmhouse character and light spices. Taste is slightly sweet and almost lambic like with brettanomyces, leather, yeast and fruits. Light body. Moderate carbonation. Dry finish. Nice brettanomyces and funk presence. Ultra drinkable. One of the best Belgian Ale w/ brettanomyces that I have tried so far. Superb!

Bouteille de 375 ml. Arômes de levure fruitée et phénolique. On reconnaît le caractère des brettanomyces. Robe blonde et moyennement trouble, effervescence active et belle mousse tenant bien. En bouche, le caractère de la levure se montre à la fois fruité (raisins verts) et phénolique (poivre, quelques notes de plastique). On retrouve également un houblonnage plutôt vert et relativement aromatique. Finale très sèche et moyennement amère. Intéressant.
UPDATED: OCT 2, 2013 Poured into a tulip glass.  Very hazy with large frothy white head.  Smell of grass and lemon very pleasant.  A little spicy a little bitter a well-balanced brew.

Bottle thanks to Sean. Pours a cloudy yellow gold with thick frothy white head that lasts leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is a strong funk, brett, and wheat. Medium mouthfeel with light wheat, strong brett in the finish. Light tartness, easy to drink, very impressive.

Bottle thanks to Matteo at the Pre-Zwanze. It pours cloudy pale orange with a small white head. The nose is apricot, peach, natural yoghurt, earthy, juicy fruit, barnyard and hay. The taste is earthy, spice, toast, grass, leaf, light tartness, apricot, peach and nectarine yoghurt with a dry, bretty finish. Medium+body and moderate-high carbonation. Nice brett character. Really rather tasty.

12.7 oz corked and caged bottle. Aroma is strong in dusty brett, a little funk and lemon rind, but mostly dust. Pours hazy cantaloupe with a giant (even with a slow pour) white head with excellent retention; leaves some sudsy lacework. Taste is crisp and clean, mostly sweet and finishing dry with a lingering unobtrusive sweetness; some very light bitterness comes out after it warms a bit. Highly carbonated, fairly light body. Good beer, not very complex or overpowering like a lot of these brett-infused beers. Simple, clean and elegant.

33cl bottle shared at Bruces. It pours golden with a big white head. Aroma is grass, hay, bretty. Some violets as well. Taste is quite bitter with a dry finish. Grass, Brett, hay and violets. Some booze as well. Mouthfeel I medium with good carbonation. Overall, quite good.

Pours very hazy and unclear amber with a white head. Aroma of citrus, straw, fresher rural notes, sweeter Belgian fruity yeasts and some leaves. Taste has nice bitter/sour brett, citrus, grapefruit, rural notes, green apples and dusty kinda hops.

Pours dirty, cloudy amber with a big white head. Aroma of leather, brett, hay, grass, citrus and a something slight sweet plumish thingy. The taste has the same contrasts in sweet and bittersour. Dry and very grainy, but still with lots of power and body. Really nice!

Bottle at pre zwanze tasting. Thanks to Matteo. Really cloudy milky yellow and scummy white head. Aroma is Brett sweet funk peach. Flavour is wheat peach and nice dry finish. Average carb. Nice interesting beer.

Bottle shared at the Pre-Zwanze tasting - London. Pours hazy gold with a fine, creamy white head. The nose has lots of barnyard and poo, some lemon. Light sweet flavor with poopy diapers, fresh grass, light rindy lemon. Light bodied with average, massaging carbonation. Lots of fresh, cleansing brett to finish, further barnyard character. Nice.

Aroma: Smelling of rhubarbs, grape-fruit, clove and yeast.Appearance: A hazy straw colored beer. 12.7oz corked bottle. pours a golden orange hue with a medium lasting white fluffy head, good lacing. Aroma of Belgian yeast, ripe apples and pears and some mild spicy fruit esters. Cloudy wet straw color. Perfect sized foamy head that really lasts.. Aroma of tart citrus, rubber and phenol. God sak, lite onykter kanske, men god och välbalanserad. Smaken varfrisk och syrlig. Gott, gott gott...

Bottle (375 ml) from Systembolaget. Shady deep golden, large white head. Bready and peppery aroma, with subtle leather brett notes. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with medium bitterness.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2013 Grumligt gul med lätt färgat skum. Doft: Brett, humle, gräs, malt. Smak: Brett, gräs, malt, citrus, humle. Provad i det som fanns att tillgå, vilket definitivt inte lyfte fram doft på något vis tyvärr.
